contextId.information: The words "will" and "forget" are understood to be part of the second phrase also. AT: "Will a virgin forget her jewelry, and will a bride forget her veils" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Will a virgin forget her jewelry, a bride her veils

contextId.information: The missing words may be added. AT: "I will smash fathers and children together" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
This sentence lists all who will be powerful and wealthy. AT: "he, his servants, and his people will ride into the palace on chariots and horses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: he, his servants, and his people

contextId.information: You may need to make this a complete sentence. AT: "and Jeremiah should hide himself too." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
AT: "all the Judeans among the people of Ammon." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The words "of the rule" are understood. AT: "in the fourth year of the rule of Jehoiakim" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: in the fourth year of Jehoiakim
